dom ferris My projects Experience Learn more Contact me

The new Dom Ferris.

Frontend developer with a love for fonts and nicely balanced compositions. The power of technology excites and motivates him to use his newfound development skills to contribute in a responsible manner. Understanding the power of effective storytelling, he hopes to work on products that are useful but also interesting to experience in a natural and unobstrusive way.

He's like the old Dom Ferris, but he codes now.

I am a recent career changer. I was a Los Angeles-based film director/editor and photographer with my last full-time job being Assistant Editor for a ViacomCBS ad agency where I supervised post production on ad campaigns for brands such as Google Pixel, McDonalds, Folgers, Target, Pampers, and many more.

I decided to pivot because I have always followed and loved the landscape of technology and would like to contribute to its future. Because I wanted to jump in sooner than later, I attended the Le Wagon coding bootcamp at their London campus after some months of self-teaching to fast charge my education.

domOS

Dom often questions why he does what he does. He likes to identify problems and then strives to solve them. Not any old problem, but big problems. Helping expose people to emotions through art. Teaching empathy and mindfulness through important stories of everyday life. Infecting individuals with a love for learning. That kind of stuff.

He hopes to take his new skills and original intentions into technology to help initiatives he believes in. The possibilities that come with the power of the internet both excite and scare him, though this motivates him to help once again - as much as he can.

Dom also likes no longer needing the many terabytes of storage necessary for HQ video and image backups. Text files rule.
